subtopic: 1.1 Minimum requirements for a filing date
scope: assessing the mandatory elements (e.g., description, claims) and their submission modes.
questions: What documents are required on the filing date for the epo to accord a filing date?
How is the filing date affected if claims are missing initially?
If no reference to any drawing is included, can missing drawings be submitted later without a change in the filing date?

scope: addressing allowed filing modes (fax, online, physical) and relevant epo sites.
questions: Which epo offices can receive an ep application filed via fax?
How do the rules differ for filing with the epo vs. National patent offices?

scope: checking if formal requirements (payment of fees, form usage, etc.) Are met.
questions: What happens if the request for grant (form 1001) is not correctly completed?
What is the procedure if the formalities officer notes a missing inventor designation?

topic: 2. Priority claims and right of priority
scope: validity criteria, same invention requirement, earliest date, and partial priorities.
questions: What conditions must be fulfilled for a valid priority claim from an earlier application?
Does the priority application need to disclose every feature claimed in the subsequent filing?

topic: 2. Priority claims and right of priority
scope: one-year priority period, procedures for requesting restoration, conditions for success.
questions: How is the 12-month priority period calculated when it ends on a weekend?
What evidence must be provided to restore priority under rule 26bis.3 pct?

topic: 2. Priority claims and right of priority
scope: handling claims that rely on more than one earlier application.
questions: Can a single claim contain subject-matter from two different priority dates?
How to split claims into portions entitled to partial priority?

scope: when a parent must still be pending, language options, and timing.
questions: By what date must a divisional be filed if the parent is due to grant?
Can a divisional be filed in a different language than its parent?

scope: compliance with article 76 epc, no added subject-matter, and ensuring unity.
questions: How is added subject-matter assessed in a divisional relative to the parent’s original disclosure?
Can a divisional cover an invention that was excluded from the parent’s search due to lack of unity?

scope: payment of filing fees, renewal fees, examination fees, and other relevant costs.
questions: When are renewal fees due for a divisional application compared to its parent?
Is any reduction possible for the filing or examination fee of a divisional?

topic: 4. Fees, payment methods, and time limits
scope: understanding different fee types (filing, search, examination, renewal, claims).
questions: How are excess claims fees calculated if claims are amended during examination?
When must the search fee be paid if the epo acts as isa under the pct?

topic: 4. Fees, payment methods, and time limits
scope: automatic debit orders, bank transfers, credit cards, and fee payment via third parties.
questions: How does an automatic debit order work and what happens if the deposit account lacks funds?
Can multiple applicants share a single deposit account for fee payment?

topic: 4. Fees, payment methods, and time limits
subtopic: 4.3 Fee deadlines and late payment consequences
scope: additional fees, surcharges, and further processing if deadlines are missed.
questions: What surcharge applies if renewal fees are not paid by the due date?
How can an applicant avoid loss of rights if a fee payment is overlooked?

subtopic: 5.1 Language of filing and procedural language
scope: filing in non-epo official languages, subsequent translation deadlines, language-based fee reductions.
questions: How long after filing must a translation be submitted if the application was filed in italian?
Which official language of the epo becomes the language of proceedings if multiple languages are used?

subtopic: 5.2 Translation requirements on grant or other stages
scope: claim translations under rule 71(3) epc, translation for validation in national phases.
questions: What is required if the text intended for grant is not in the applicant’s preferred official language?
Does the applicant need to file translations in all contracting states after grant?

subtopic: 5.3 Effects of language on costs and procedural rights
scope: fee reductions for certain languages, language-based rights of small entities or universities.
questions: What reduction in examination fees applies for a university filing in an official language of an epc contracting state?
Can an applicant who filed in spanish benefit from a fee reduction?

scope: available for missed deadlines in examination or other proceedings, scope of remedy, exceptions.
questions: For which official time limits is further processing not available?
How must an applicant request further processing after failing to respond to an examination report?

scope: conditions (all due care), time limit for requesting, and required evidence.
questions: What steps demonstrate “all due care” to justify re-establishment?
When does the two-month time limit for re-establishment start running if an applicant misses a final deadline?

scope: notices of loss of rights, deemed withdrawals, subsequent procedural options.
questions: When is a communication under rule 112(1) epc issued, and how to react?
Is an appeal possible against a deemed withdrawal?

topic: 7. Pct procedure and entry into the european phase
scope: filing at receiving offices, international search by epo or other isas, invited corrections.
questions: Which receiving office can a us applicant choose when filing a pct application?
What happens if the applicant fails to pay the international filing fee within the deadline?

topic: 7. Pct procedure and entry into the european phase
scope: filing a demand, timing for article 34 amendments, unity objections at iper stage.
questions: When must the demand for international preliminary examination be filed at the epo as ipea?
How are amendments under article 34 pct handled differently from article 19 pct amendments?

topic: 7. Pct procedure and entry into the european phase
scope: minimum actions to enter ep phase (translations, fees, etc.), optional actions (requesting examination).
questions: What are the minimum requirements to validly enter the european phase under articles 22/39 pct?
Is an additional search fee always required in the ep phase if the epo was the isa?

scope: responding to article 94(3) communications, telephone consultations with examiners, time limit extensions.
questions: What are the applicant’s options upon receiving an objection regarding lack of clarity under article 84?
Is an in-person hearing possible before the examining division issues a final decision?

scope: no added subject-matter, no broadening after grant, clarity considerations.
questions: How is an amendment evaluated for compliance with article 123(2)?
When is it permissible to delete features from the original independent claim?

subtopic: 8.3 Grant stage (rule 71(3) epc) and post-grant publication
scope: paying the fee for grant and publishing, submitting claim translations, final text for publication.
questions: What steps must be completed before the decision to grant is issued?
What happens if errors are found in the druckexemplar after paying the grant fee?

scope: novelty, inventive step, subject-matter not patentable, insufficiency of disclosure, extension beyond original filing.
questions: Can an opponent rely on lack of clarity under article 84 epc as a ground for opposition?
Is lack of unity a valid ground for opposition?

scope: formal requirements (time limits, opponent identity), partial opposition, withdrawal of opposition.
questions: Is it possible to oppose only one independent claim of a granted patent?
How does the epo handle late-filed documents in opposition?

scope: grounds of appeal, fresh evidence, remittal, boards’ powers, and procedures.
questions: Can a new ground for opposition be introduced during appeal without the patentee’s consent?
What is the composition of a board of appeal deciding a patent case?

topic: 10. Substantive patent law: novelty and inventive step
scope: defining prior art, comparing features, selection inventions, disclaimers.
questions: How is novelty assessed against a document that discloses a range overlapping the claimed range?
Does prior use by the applicant themselves destroy novelty?

topic: 10. Substantive patent law: novelty and inventive step
scope: closest prior art selection, objective technical problem, and problem-solution approach.
questions: Can a known alternative material render the claim obvious if it provides no improved result?
How does the examiner establish a lack of inventive step if the solution is an obvious combination of known teachings?

topic: 10. Substantive patent law: novelty and inventive step
subtopic: 10.3 Special forms of claims (e.g., medical use)
scope: swiss-type, article 54(5) epc second medical use claims, allowable claim wording.
questions: What is the difference between swiss-type claims and epc 2000 medical use claims?
How is novelty established for a second or further medical use?

scope: disputes over who owns the right to a european patent application or patent.
questions: How can proceedings be stayed if entitlement proceedings are initiated before a national court?
What is the effect on the ongoing examination of a pending entitlement dispute?

scope: formalities for registering changes in ownership, partial transfers, and licensing.
questions: Which documents are needed to record a transfer of rights in the european patent register?
Does a partial assignment allow different co-owners in different designated states?

scope: impact on deadlines, actions that can/cannot be taken by a transferee before registration.
questions: At what point can the transferee begin prosecuting the application in their own name?
Is there a fee for recording a transfer at the epo?

scope: mandatory wipo standard, electronic submission, late furnishing fees.
questions: What are the consequences if a sequence listing is not filed upon request?
In what format must the sequence listing be provided under wipo standard st.25 or st.26?

scope: ensuring that no new sequences or mutations are introduced beyond the original disclosure.
questions: How is compliance with article 123(2) epc checked for nucleotide and amino acid sequences?

scope: exclusions (plant/animal varieties, essentially biological processes), rule 28 epc.
questions: What biotech inventions are explicitly excluded from patentability under the epc?
Does the epc allow gene editing claims for plants?

scope: criteria for single general inventive concept, partial search where unity is lacking.
questions: How does the epo handle multiple independent claims that appear unrelated?
Can the epo invite payment of additional search fees for non-unified claims during ep examination?

scope: international phase unity criteria, additional fees for multiple inventions, protest procedure.
questions: What steps can an applicant take if the isa invites payment of additional search fees?
Is it possible to pursue unsearched inventions in a later european divisional?

subtopic: 13.3 Strategies for overcoming lack of unity
scope: amendments, selecting one invention to proceed with, potential divisional filings.
questions: Which claims should be retained if the applicant pays no additional search fees?
How does an applicant choose the invention providing the strongest prospect of allowance?
